content.description: This route is located left of the prominent orange wall that contains two bolted face routes.  Orange Peel starts off a couple of blocks against the base of the wall and climbs a thin finger crack in a left facing corner.  After a slick start, work up the thin crack using intermittent and shallow finger holds � the majority of the crack is tips at best.  There are some good flakes a little over half way to the top that offer solid climbing a good holds on the face.  Once above these flakes, its easy climbing to the anchors.  Rap with one rope.  You can easily top rope this route, but there will be some rope drag across the low angle rock near the anchors
content.protection: Standard rack with an emphasis on small gear (TCUs and small Aliens)

content.description: Orange Juice climbs the thin face between Orange Peel and Journey to Evermore.  Start on the face to the right of Thors Flake (at the start of Evermore) and work up thin friction moves to a flake with a good side pull.  This flake offers a bit of a rest before the crux which is adjacent to the horizontal flake on Evermore.  Once past the crux, its easier climbing to the anchors.  This climb received and X rating in the guide book, but can be top roped from the Orange Peel anchors.

Left of Thor's Flake there is a wall and an arete running up the left side as you face it and then bends at the top.  The route follows steep holds on flakes getting up to the arete with hard boulder moves followed by steep lieback of the overhanging arete.  Powerful route.
content.protection: Toprope on removeable hardware using crack system at the top.
content.location: Left of Clockwerk Orange and Left of Thor's Flake

content.description: Climb the vertical crack starting from within the crevice behind the Triple Cracks buttress. Starts out as a hand crack and soon becomes off-width. The crack narrows again on the lower angle rock above the off-width section. The wide part feels hard for the grade. After topping out and bringing up the second, scramble up 3rd/4th class to Smorgasbord, and either walk off or descend the crevice down to Orange Peel area.
content.protection: A standard rack up to about a number 4 will protect the crack. However, you will need some extra big pieces and/or creative anchor building skills to rig a top anchor. There are no bolts or top anchors on this climb.
content.location: Located about half way up the 3rd class crevice which runs behind the Triple Cracks buttress from Orange Peel to Smorgasbord. If traveling up the crevice from Orange Peel, Obscured by Clouds will be on your left.

content.description: This is a nice face climb on some small edges.
content.location: From the main landing head to the shaded and sheltered section to the left.  It is right of the tree and climbs right of where the tree branches touch the wall.

content.description: Climb Thor's Flake (the triangular flake resting against the Main Dome, left of Orange Peal), find a single bolt on the wall above Thor's Flake, continue up the water streak, join with Orange Peal,  follow the protectable upper reaches of Orange Peal to the bolted anchor.  Mildly run out, but the crux is protected by the bolt.
content.protection: 1 bolt. A single rack from small to medium is sufficient. A long runner or two may help. There is a bolted anchor at the top (shared with Orange Peal). A single 60 will make it if you aim for the boulder pile to the rappeler's left. If you aim too far right (toward Clockwerk Orange) a 60 will come up short. Use knots in the ends of your rope.
content.location: Located to the climber's left of Orange Peal, between Orange Peal and the crevice.

content.description: Climb a long chimney to a big chockstone. Pull past this and then up through friction slab.
content.protection: Can be led with difficulty and runout placements. Medium to wide gear. Can also be toproped using the Orange Peel anchors. Some climbers may want to place a directional piece to reduce the pendulum swing if toproping.
content.location: Start in the chimney below and to the left of Thor's Flake, which is located just left of the start of Orange Peel.

content.description: Climbs through thin edges and crimps starting left of the tree.  Stellar climb at the grade.  Originally rated 11a, but recent repeats look to downgrade it.  A good slab climber it will feel more like a moderate to hard 10.
content.protection:
3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. 

  To set up a TR, climb Mystery and imagination and traverse to the Clockwerk anchor.
content.location: Left side of Orange peel area at the nice sheltered landing.  Staring left of the tree.  Rap off.

content.description: Despite the modest grade, Cave Crack is one of the best routes in the park.  Fun climbing, great protection, and a unique location make this climb a must do.  The start of Cave Crack is located above Jack Knife (see Throne Rock).  While it's possible to scramble through the boulders to reach to base, climbing Jack Knife is a lot easier (and more enjoyable).  From the top of Jack Knife, scramble down the back side of the summit block and scamper through a small opening under a large detached boulder.  Once you stand up, you'll be in a narrow, chimney-like space with a hand crack that splits the back wall.  Follow the crack for about fifty feet until you reach the top of the cave.  The crack starts as a hand crack and gradually widens as you move up.  At the top of the cave, step left onto the face, continue around the corner, and work up the widening crack.  Above the cave, the angle eases significantly, and you can walk up the rest of the climb until you find a comfortable spot to belay.  To descend, scramble down the easy slab to the anchors above Orange Peel and rap with a single rope to the base.  Great climbing in the summer when the rest of E-Rock is too hot to touch.
content.protection: Standard rack with cams up to a 3.5 Camalot.

climbs.name: Agent Orange
climbs.fa: Jeff Jackson, Keith Wright, Kurt Floyd

content.description: Uses the anchors for Orange Peel.  Uses the face and arete combo just to the right of the arete of Orange Peel.  Starts on the wall at the base below the boulders used to start Orange Peel on the same level as the start for Clockwerk Orange.  Combination of powerful liebacks with delicate face moves.  Amazing route that is made more difficult by the presence of the tree branch half way up that the route gets in the way of.  This route theoretically could be done trad by placing pieces in the Orange Peel crack.
content.protection: 2 chains at the top. No bolts.  Top-rope.
content.location: Left of Clockwerk Orange and big tree at the base next to the large boulders used to get up to the beginning of Orange Peel.  Just to the right of Orange Peel

content.description: The Orange Peel Area is the collection of climbs between Throne Rock and the Triple Cracks Sanctuary on the wall behind Motorboat Rock.  The majority of the routes here are bolted face climbs that ascend the orange colored rock (hence the name).  Cave Crack (5.6) is probably the best moderate trad route in the park.
